laboratory_examinations.findings: Combined restrictive and obstructive ventilatory defect with a severe reduction in diffusion capacity (27% predicted).

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Hypoxia and interstitial infiltrates progressed over 3 months.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Insufficient tissue for analysis; no lipid-laden macrophages noted in the lavage fluid.
Pathologic diagnosis of exogenous lipoid pneumonia.
Initial serum troponin concentration was 17.7 µg/L; peak value at 24 hours was 27.3 µg/L.
Initial plasma B-type natriuretic peptide value on admission was 620.6 ng/L.
Global left ventricular ejection fraction less than 0.20.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increased to 0.40 on day 2 and to 0.50 on day 3.
